intro: Fadogia ancylantha, commonly known as African musk or the "horned" plant, is a flowering plant native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, horn-like seed pods. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, and it produces a strong, aromatic scent. Fadogia ancylantha is also noted for its traditional use in herbal medicine.
